channel.title: Windows Vista [REPAIR DISCS]
channel.description: Hey, I need some help! I have a Windows Vista 'Compaq' computer. I tried to boot it up last week, and it said: [code] BOOTMGR not found... Press any key to shut down... [/code] I've tried to find repair discs for the computer, but cannot do so because the informational sticker on the side was ripped off, and now I cannot find the proper discs. Help? I don't have enough money to replace it.

item.title: Windows Vista [REPAIR DISCS]
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“peterbjornx, post:6, topic:412534”]1 like zachera said , burn the disks (literally) ,
2 use someone elses computer to download a good linux distro
3 burn it to DVD ,
4 install it
5 HAVE FUN
6 Next time post in appropriate section[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Vista [REPAIR DISCS]
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

Throw the discs in a fire (bonus points: send pics to Microsoft), then go buy Windows 7.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Vista [REPAIR DISCS]
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Steven™, post:3, topic:412534”][quote author=sppt link=topic=513796.msg3730319#msg3730319 date=1314577531]
Get a vista disc, boot it, and go into “recovery mode” I think it’s called, there should be an option to fix the bootloader.
[/quote]
Are you talking about like a “Windows Vista Package”? Like say I was upgrading from Windows XP to Windows Vista?[/quote]
No, the regular installation discs should do.
When you boot those up, it should offer you to repair your pc somewhere in the first screens, do that, and select the option to fix boot related problems, I’m not sure what it’s called.

Read full topic

Get a vista disc, boot it, and go into “recovery mode” I think it’s called, there should be an option to fix the bootloader.

item.title: Windows Vista [REPAIR DISCS]
item.dc:creator: @Steven2 Steven™
item.description:
@Steven2 wrote:

Hey, I need some help! I have a Windows Vista ‘Compaq’ computer. I tried to boot it up last week, and it said:

BOOTMGR not found...
Press any key to shut down...

I’ve tried to find repair discs for the computer, but cannot do so because the informational sticker on the side was ripped off, and now I cannot find the proper discs. Help? I don’t have enough money to replace it.

Read full topic
